justification: Good recognition of B’s conservative floor-seeking and contrarian streak, plus WR depth and Taylor’s volatility/tough playoff slate. However, it overlooks B’s stated preference for possession receivers and high-powered offenses—Anderson (Tier 5, outside, mid variance, not possession) doesn’t fit. Trading B’s Tier 1 workhorse (Taylor) for a Tier 5 workhorse (Robinson) contradicts zero-RB scarcity value. Reasoning distinguishes A vs B aims, but the offer is lopsided and rationale overstates Anderson’s stability, reducing coherence.
